C2 something that is impossible to do, or the state of being impossible: What you're asking just can't be done - it's an impossibility. She finally acknowledged the impossibility of keeping her boyfriend secret. See
impossible
More examplesFewer examplesViewing an actual atom was like trying to touch the sun, a physical impossibility.I think it's almost an impossibility to stamp out deformed genes.Recognizing the impossibility of attaining their ideals in England, they planned to settle in America.
